channel.title: [TUT] How to Fix webclient errors (VERY DETAILED)
channel.description:
[b]Table of contents:[/b]
[b]1[/b]..........................How to fix "OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space"
[b]2[/b]..........................How to fix "Error: Startup error 20"
[b]3[/b]..........................How to jar/sign The client correctly (45% COMPLETE) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1. [b]Fixing "OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space"[/b]
First go to control panel [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/opnu6f.jpg[/img] And click classical view and then click "java"
This little screen should pop up: [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/x0nv3t.jpg[/img]
Click on java [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/2ypb5zl.jpg[/img]
Then click on the first view button: [IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/wvsa6b.jpg[/img]
It should look like this: [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/bhf5i0.jpg[/img]
Find the latest Virsion of JRE on the list and add [code]-Xmx300m[/code] To the java runtime pro... It should look like this but with your virson of JRE: [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/2h35vye.jpg[/img]
Click 'OK' to exit all dialogs. Close the control panel window. NOTE:Exit ALL web browser windows. (VERY IMPORTANT)
And there you go! You should Now be able to login to your webclient!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------
2.[b]How to fix "Error: Startup error 20"[/b]
This one is an easy one to fix. First what you want to do is open up your Class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.java And Search: [code]Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage[/code]
If you have followed sora's Tutorial Correctly it should say: [code]Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("C:/.store_name_32/Sprites/(SPRITE NAME)");[/code] If not Go back and read Sora's tutorial Through Again And READ what it says After you do that it should load correctly.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b]Credits:[/b]
Me I sora I Tinypic
[b]More tutorials coming soon![/b]

item.title: [TUT] How to Fix webclient errors (VERY DETAILED)
item.dc:creator: @kelly15 kelly15
item.description:
@kelly15 wrote:

Nice but I get a error cannot find client.class can you please help me or you can test it out at http://freezescape.net/testwebclient.php that was a test webclient it keeps saying cannot find “client.class”

item.title: [TUT] How to Fix webclient errors (VERY DETAILED)
item.dc:creator: @glenash glenash
item.description:
@glenash wrote:

java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1013478509 in class file Applet_Sub1 at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1013478509 in class file Applet_Sub1

I get that error when i try to open my webclient.

Read full topic
item.source: [TUT] How to Fix webclient errors (VERY DETAILED)

item.title: [TUT] How to Fix webclient errors (VERY DETAILED)
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Good tut, but i discovered something, to fix the heap space bullshit, just use this :

[b] [/b]

the bit in the middle designates a given memory to the applet, so you can run rs HD 317
I would reccommend 500, but put this in the tut and you dont really have to give me creds, im just helping.

Also, feel free to add this:

To make a webclient refreshable, add this to the section of html :

This is by far my greatest discovery, and if it doesnt work , refresh the page again. Im working on a double refresher for now.

Please give creds for bottom fix.

item.dc:creator: @ProjectDiabolus ProjectDiabolus
item.description:
@ProjectDiabolus wrote:

Also, if you cant find Private void Method67, (Happens alot to people) search Public static void method67 (In some older clients) or Public void Method67, if still nothing, just search method67. It should be the first one.

@java_is_my_bitch1 wrote:

Table of contents:

1…How to fix “OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space”

2…How to fix “Error: Startup error 20”

3…How to jar/sign The client correctly (45% COMPLETE)

  1. Fixing “OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space”

First go to control panel

opnu6f.jpg740×282

And click classical view and then click “java”

This little screen should pop up:

Click on java

Then click on the first view button:

It should look like this:

Find the latest Virsion of JRE on the list and add

-Xmx300m

To the java runtime pro…
It should look like this but with your virson of JRE:

Click ‘OK’ to exit all dialogs. Close the control panel window.
NOTE:Exit ALL web browser windows. (VERY IMPORTANT)

And there you go!
You should Now be able to login to your webclient!

2.How to fix “Error: Startup error 20”

This one is an easy one to fix.
First what you want to do is open up your Class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.java
And Search:

Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage

If you have followed sora’s Tutorial Correctly it should say:

Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("C:/.store_name_32/Sprites/(SPRITE NAME)");

If not Go back and read Sora’s tutorial Through Again And READ what it says
After you do that it should load correctly.
